Posts.EditableText:
Hi, this is simply a plea for friendship, I have an app called discord that can allow some of us to chat strictly about gaming.  Mostly I want to create a group that could work together on problems and solve them, or even propose ideas to each other.  

Mostly I would prefer 'Quest' game makers, but all are welcome, just direct message me if you want to connect, also if you create an account just send me your ID.
Posts.HTML:
Hi, this is simply a plea for friendship, I have an app called discord that can allow some of us to chat strictly about gaming. Mostly I want to create a group that could work together on problems and solve them, or even propose ideas to each other.

Mostly I would prefer 'Quest' game makers, but all are welcome, just direct message me if you want to connect, also if you create an account just send me your ID.

Posts.EditableText: Ok here is a link straight to the server, it expires within a day so I will keep updating this thread: https://discord.gg/84PnJS
Posts.HTML: Ok here is a link straight to the server, it expires within a day so I will keep updating this thread: https://discord.gg/84PnJS

Posts.EditableText:
I tried to fire that up one time when there was some sort of problem with the servers/forum boards (whatever it was).  I only got one or two people that popped in there.  It is very nice to have a few "live" minds available at any given instance to help with problems.  The problem I ran into is that I was the only "mind" (and I use that term loosely) available it seemed who stopped in and there were only a couple people who visited for help.  I think I did help them create a game and it was fun doing it in a more live format than just the message board.  The only downside was the lack of traffic.

In short, I may pop in and get a feel for the traffic.  

By the way, to others, discord is pretty nice because you can have big group text (or live) chats as well as  sub-groups and PMs.  You could also probably copy-paste any solutions to a git-hub or directly to this forum to help others that don't stop in but have the same problem.

It's a neat idea, but I'm afraid there won't be enough traffic to make it worthwhile.  At least, I am willing to check it out and see if it goes.

It is very nice to have a few "live" minds available at any given instance to help with problems. The problem I ran into is that I was the only "mind" (and I use that term loosely) available it seemed who stopped in and there were only a couple people who visited for help. I think I did help them create a game and it was fun doing it in a more live format than just the message board. The only downside was the lack of traffic.

In short, I may pop in and get a feel for the traffic.

By the way, to others, discord is pretty nice because you can have big group text (or live) chats as well as sub-groups and PMs. You could also probably copy-paste any solutions to a git-hub or directly to this forum to help others that don't stop in but have the same problem.

It's a neat idea, but I'm afraid there won't be enough traffic to make it worthwhile. At least, I am willing to check it out and see if it goes.
